item.title: UBS Sees Harris Win Lifting Utility Debt, Trump Boosting Energy
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- A Kamala Harris victory in the US presidential election would boost the bonds of basic industry, capital goods companies and utilities, according to Matthew Mish, head of credit strategy at UBS. “A lot of that we think is tied to the preservation of the inflation reduction act and su...

item.title: UAE Looks to Put Economics First on President’s Washington Trip
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- United Arab Emirates President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed will prioritize talks on economic ties ahead of geopolitics during his first trip to Washington as the country’s ruler. The leader widely known as MBZ will next week hold discussions with President Joe Biden and Vice President ...

item.title: Deutsche Bank Taps UBS’s Gasser to Run German Wealth Unit
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Deutsche Bank AG hired Raffael Gasser as head of wealth management and private banking Germany, tapping another former colleague of Private Bank head Claudio de Sanctis for a key role. Gasser, who will start in November and report to de Sanctis, joins from UBS Group AG, where he led ...

item.title: Germany May Already Be in Mild Recession, Bundesbank Says
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Germany’s economy may already be in recession, but a severe economic slump looks unlikely as things stand, according to the Bundesbank. Gross domestic product “could stagnate or decline slightly again” in the third quarter, after a surprise 0.1% contraction in the second, the central ...

item.title: ECB’s Knot Is Comfortable With Market’s Rate-Cut Expectations
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- European Central Bank Governing Council member Klaas Knot said he’s comfortable with investor bets on further interest-rate cuts. Markets see one or two additional quarter-point moves in 2024, with borrowing costs settling at 2% after six more next year. Knot told an event in Istanbul...

item.title: ECB May Have to Accelerate Rate Cuts, Centeno Tells Politico
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank may have to quicken the pace that it lowers interest rates to avoid inflation falling short of forecasts, Governing Council member Mario Centeno told Politico. “Given the position in which we are today, in the monetary policy cycle, we have really to minimize...

item.title: Ehemaliges Union-Investment-Vorstandsmitglied Höger verstorben
item.author: Bloomberg News (German)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Horst Höger, ehemaliges Vorstandsmitglied von Union Investment, ist gestern verstorben. Er wurde 85 Jahre alt. Dem Tod sei eine schwere Krankheit vorausgegangen, teilte Union Investment am Donnerstag mit. Von 2001 bis zu seinem Eintritt in den Ruhestand zum Jahresbeginn 2004 war Höger...

item.description: Börsen-Zeitung, 20.9.2024 Die Deutsche Bank hat die Nachfolge von Lars Stoy, der zur ING geht, abschließend geregelt. Der UBS-Banker Raffael Gasser wird vom 1. November an das Geschäftsfeld Wealth Management & Private Banking in Deutschland leiten, das sich um vermögende Kunden kümmert, teilte die B...

item.title: UBS sieht bei Komax die Trendwende
item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Die Aktien des Kabel-Maschinenherstellers Komax handeln am Donnerstag kurz nach Börseneröffnung knapp sechs Prozent im Plus bei 124,60 Franken. item.title: Bundesbank: Deutsche Wirtschaft bleibt in 'schwierigem Fahrwasser'
item.author: cash.ch
item.description: Gestiegene Finanzierungskosten bremsten unter anderem die Geschäfte in der Bauwirtschaft. Die Bundesbank stellt zudem fest, dass trotz höherer Löhne der private Konsum nicht in Schwung kommt.
